simulated_ratings.title: Inception (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, layered dream-heist thrills and mystery scratch my itch for cerebral tension.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, world-building animation that deepens a tech-noir setting keeps me intrigued despite the short form.

simulated_ratings.title: Gladiator (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A gripping revenge arc with weighty stakes and visceral battles pulled me in.

simulated_ratings.title: Hoodwinked Too! Hood vs. Evil (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Playful fairy-tale riff, but the humor feels thin and disposable to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Casino Royale (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grounded spy tension and high-stakes poker mind games hit a satisfying action-thriller groove.

simulated_ratings.title: Greyhound (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Taut naval cat-and-mouse intensity works well as a focused wartime procedural.

simulated_ratings.title: Up in the Air (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A sharp, quiet character study about isolation and connection that lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic mythic adventure with propulsive charm and swashbuckling spirit still works.

simulated_ratings.title: Godfather: Part III, The (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The reflective arc interests me, but it lacks the punch and precision I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Last Samurai, The (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Honor-bound drama and immersive battles engage me even if the beats feel familiar.

simulated_ratings.title: Notebook, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sincere and sweeping, but the melodrama runs heavy for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Usual Suspects, The (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A clever, twisty crime puzzle that kept me guessing and satisfied.

simulated_ratings.title: Black Mass (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gritty true-crime intensity holds my attention without fully flooring me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Hand Behind the Mouse: The Ub Iwerks Story (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Behind-the-scenes creativity and animation history make for engaging, informative viewing.

simulated_ratings.title: Archive (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The moody AI premise intrigues me, though the slow-burn approach tempers my enthusiasm.

simulated_ratings.title: Dark Knight, The (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless crime-thriller momentum and a chaotic mastermind make it gripping.

simulated_ratings.title: Braveheart (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rousing rebellion drama with emotional stakes and brutal clashes lands well.

simulated_ratings.title: Skyfall (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick, personal stakes and stylish set pieces deliver a strong Bond chapter.

simulated_ratings.title: Crash (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The conceptual look at conformity and collapse engages me more intellectually than emotionally.

simulated_ratings.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A steady endurance journey and homefront struggle make for a solid wartime romance.

simulated_ratings.title: Dark Knight Rises, The (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A big, brooding finale that works even if it’s less tight than its predecessor.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A fun rescue and final showdown satisfy, though it feels more straightforward.

simulated_ratings.title: Moulin Rouge (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lavish and passionate, but the musical excess can overwhelm me.

simulated_ratings.title: Lucky Number Slevin (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snappy, twist-driven crime fun with overlapping agendas hits the spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Final Destination (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The fate-hunts-you concept is inventive and tense even when it gets a bit repetitive.

simulated_ratings.title: What the #$*! Do We Know!? (a.k.a. What the Bleep Do We Know!?) (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: Newsies (1992)

simulated_ratings.title: Irreversible (Irréversible) (2002)

simulated_ratings.title: Antichrist (2009)
